title: Myanmar's earthquake damage adds to junta's cruelty: 'It's one trauma after another'
summary: The March 28 earthquake's official death toll stands at 3,645, but it could reach double that. Myanmar's population was already severely wracked by the civil war, and the military government's response is insufficient.

title: US exempts tech imports in tariff step back
summary: These exemptions notably apply to high-tech products imported to the US from China, on which Donald Trump had imposed a 145% tariff rate.

title: How gender became a scapegoat for illiberal right-wing movements
summary: The concept of gender, which originated in the US in the '50s and is commonly used in the social sciences, is core to a culture war led by reactionary leaders, from Trump to Putin and Milei, against liberal democracies' equality policies.

title: 'The myth of a streamlined, low-cost Chinese AI, embodied by DeepSeek, could collapse as quickly as it appeared'
summary: In an op-ed for Le Monde, legal expert Isabelle Feng reminds us that Chinese leaders are also masters in the art of claiming technological successes that do not necessarily materialize. Behind DeepSeek's apparent 'success,' she primarily sees a well-oiled communication operation.

title: 'Black Mirror' on Netflix: Our minds challenged by new technologies
summary: The seventh season of the dystopian series created by Charlie Brooker is enjoyable to watch, even though the writing struggles to innovate.

title: At the Paris Opera, two dazzling ballets bridging contemporary and classical dance
summary: Between 'Sleeping Beauty' at Bastille and the double program 'Sharon Eyal / Mats Ek' at the Palais Garnier, the troupe of dancers is in top form.

title: For the protectionist French left, Trump's trade war is a thorn in the side
summary: The radical left, advocating 'solidarity protectionism,' has sought to distinguish itself from the American president's methods. But economists warn such measures are far from easy to implement.

title: NBA: For French coaches, America remains uncharted territory
summary: There are foreign players galore in the North American basketball league. But for international coaches, the opportunities are still much more rare.

title: Budapest goes 'Gray Pride' as protesters in muted tones mock Pride ban law
summary: On Monday, the parliament is set to vote on a constitutional amendment that would strengthen the legal foundations for the prohibition of the Pride march. Waving gray flags, including rainbow flags turned monochromatic, more than 10,000 people joined the humourous demonstration with a serious cause in Budapest on Saturday.

title: US-Iran nuclear talks in Oman 'constructive,' both sides say
summary: Negotiators from the two countries spoke directly for 'a few minutes' and will meet again next week, Iran's foreign ministry said. Donald Trump, speaking with reporters Saturday on Air Force One, said 'the Iran situation is going pretty good, I think.'

title: Israel expands Gaza offensive and issues evacuation orders
summary: Israeli Defense Minister Israel Katz stated that Israeli army operations would soon 'intensify and expand to other areas throughout most of Gaza,' as an evacuation order was issued for Khan Yunis ahead of a rocket attack.

title: A war of nerves sets in between the US and China, with trade already hit
summary: As the two nations engage in an escalation of tariff measures, their trade has already begun to plummet. While Beijing has long been preparing to decouple from the American economy, its exporters are suffering.

title: UK passes emergency law to stop British Steel plant closure
summary: In a rare weekend session, the British parliament approved a law to give the government power to take over assets if the plant's Chinese executives failed to comply with instructions to keep the blast furnaces running.

title: Between China and the US, the European Union seeks the right balance
summary: Donald Trump's aggressive stance leaves Europeans wary. They also distrust China's unfair trade practices even as they seek to build a better relationship with Beijing.

title: As Iran nuclear talks get underway in Oman, excluded Europeans are wary
summary: Talks between Tehran and Washington on Iran's nuclear program were to resume in Oman on Saturday, without European countries participating, despite their involvement in the previous agreement.

title: French tourists are turning away from the US
summary: Travel agencies are seeing a notable decline in bookings due to prices and the political context. Among those who do choose to go to the US, travel habits are changing.

title: Pro-Palestinian student Mahmoud Khalil can be deported, US court says
summary: The Columbia University activist can be deported, ruled a federal judge on Friday. Beyond his case, hundreds of foreign students enrolled in American universities have had their visas revoked.

title: In Milan, design embraces color
summary: A sofa reimagined by Pedro Almodóvar, multicolored glasses from Hermès... Until April 13, amidst guests from the film industry and fashion houses, the Lombard capital is bursting into color.

title: Behind Paris's promise to plant 170,000 trees, a more nuanced reality
summary: Paris City Hall has a pro-greening policy, but in practice, NGOs are condemning a 'numbers game' and a lack of care for trees.

title: Algeria protests after consular official indicted in France
summary: Three men, one of whom works at an Algerian consulate in France, were indicted Friday in Paris on suspicion of involvement in the abduction of 41-year-old Amir Boukhors, an influencer on TikTok.

title: Özgür Özel, the apparatchik turned Turkey's chief opponent
summary: The leader of the Republican People's Party, the main opposition force in the country, relentlessly denounces the authoritarian drift of Recep Tayyip Erdogan. New anti-government protests are planned for Sunday.

title: World Expo opens in Osaka, Japan, with message of 'unity'
summary: The event opened its gates on Sunday, with 160 countries and regions showcasing their technology, culture and food.

title: Israel strikes Gaza hospital as it intensifies assault
summary: The strike on Al-Ahli Hospital in northern Gaza caused heavy damage but no causualities, as it had been evacuated. Israel said it targeted a Hamas 'command and control center.'

title: War in Ukraine: Russian missile strike on Sumy kills at least 21
summary: A Russian ballistic missile attack on the northeastern Ukrainian city of Sumy, near the border with Russia's Kursk region, left at least 21 dead and 83 wounded, on the Christian holy day of Palm Sunday.

title: When the 'Beatles' of the Islamic State group ruled Syria's prisons
summary: The shadow of the four executioners with British accents often loomed over the trial of the jailers and torturers of the Islamic State group, held this winter in Paris. One was killed in a US airstrike in Syria in 2015, and three others are imprisoned in the US and the UK.

title: The French far right has a Donald Trump problem
summary: While Marine Le Pen has distanced herself from Trump, she has also refrained from criticizing the core ideas behind his radical and erratic policies, whose harmful effects could undermine her own credibility.

title: Ethiopia's Hirpa and Kenya's Biwott triumph at Paris Marathon
summary: Bedatu Hirpa overtook Dera Dida in the final meters of the women's race, while Benard Biwott comofrtably won in the men's event.

title: Trump, Putin and the two Middle East triangles
summary: Donald Trump is seeking, in vain, to harmonize the two three-way relationships he maintains with Vladimir Putin – one with Israel's Benjamin Netanyahu, the other with Saudi Arabia's Mohammed bin Salman.

title: Trump's doctor finds president in 'excellent health' after physical
summary: The doctor's report released by the White House noted only a few abnormalities, including minor sun damage to Trump's skin and scarring on his right ear from a gunshot wound after he was shot at in an assassination.

title: Pope Francis makes public appearance in St Peter's Square for Palm Sunday
summary: The pope, who is recovering from pneumonia, surprised worshippers a the Vatican for the second straight Sunday.

title: 'Negotiations with North Korea in 2019 showed that Trump can quickly tire of complicated issues'
summary: The fact that the 'deal' to denuclearize Pyongyang went nowhere does not reassure those who hope that Donald Trump can resolve the situations in Ukraine, Gaza, or Iran, explains Le Monde's Philippe Ricard in his column.

title: Van der Poel wins third consecutive Paris-Roubaix
summary: Dutch rider Mathieu van der Poel distanced second-placed Tadej Pogacar when the Slovenian fell 38 kilometers from the finish line.

title: The reactionary international: How three ideological families are united in hating progressivism
summary: Three ideological currents – ultraconservative Christians, national-populists and techno-libertarians – though often at odds, have all been buoyed by Donald Trump's victory.
